author: Special Correspondent
text:
For its failure to take steps to solve the dispute between residents and temple authorities

: Cadre of the People’s Welfare Front comprising of the two Left parties, Marumalarchi Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam and Viduthalai Chiruthaigal Katchi on Friday hit out at the ruling AIADMK government for not having solved the vexed issue relating to ownership of properties around the Srirangam Sri Ranganathaswamy Temple.

Members of the four parties staged a demonstration at Srirangam on this issue and accused the AIADMK government of having given a false promise during the run up to the 2011 election campaign in resolving the vexed issue after coming to power.

Carrying their respective party flags, the demonstrators raised slogans condemning the AIADMK government for its failure to take steps to solve the dispute between the residents and the Srirangam temple authorities with respect to ownership of properties around the temple.

The demonstration was led by VCK urban district secretary A. Arul. MDMK urban district secretary Vellamandi Somu, former CPI MLA V. Sivapunniyam, CPI urban district secretary Suresh, CPI-M urban district secretary R. Raja and others took part.

They wanted to know as to why it had not resolved the issue concerning the residents of Srirangam even after remaining in power for five years.
title: PWF flays AIADMK
